turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I'm not sure how this works.  Do you have something for me... ?  I got this note...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: What are you babbling about, psycho?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I want to know what's going on.  Are you part of this?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: What's going on?  I'm going on my second job this month, and now I'm going on unemployment.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Excuse me, I need to explain...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Do you know what to do?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Don't just stand there, get help!

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: He's pissing his pants.  Is that real enough for you?  Call 911!

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Ten minutes ago, I'm looking forward to a quiet dinner.  I get a note...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Let's talk to whoever can get this over with...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Hold on...  They want your driver's license number.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I was trying to tell you... it's a game.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It's run by a company... they play elaborate pranks.  Things like this. I'm really only now finding out myself.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: The lights went out, one hundred people all ran away...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: You mean, the guy who turned blue and <u>wet</u> himself... ?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: There's got to be a flashlight.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I don't understand why they're getting you involved.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: How do you know that's the way?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Where'd you all go?  Motherfucking frat boys.  You better hide.  Is your life so pathetic that this is something you're willing to pay for?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It was a gift... from my brother.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: How thoughtful.  The gift of inconvenience.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Long story.  I found this key in the mouth of a wooden Harlequin.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Read what it says: "Warning, do <u>not</u> attempt to open.  If elevator stops, use emergency... "

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: "... wait for help."  Wait for help. I'm not opening a door that specifically warns me not to.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Are you suggesting we wait till someone finds us?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: This isn't an attempt to be gallant. If I don't lift you, how are you going to get there?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It's much easier this way.  Come on, step up...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I'm not wearing underwear.  Okay? There, I said it.  Satisfied.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It's not like anyone could actually open it.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Consumer Recreation Services.  It's their building.  They...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Don't panic.  When security gets here, we simply explain what happened...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: You're a grown man.  I'm not responsible for you.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: You're the one who started running.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Me?  You're the one who... !  Shit!

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Nicholas Van Orton?  What are you, a czar?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: We hang down here and drop.  The garbage'll break our fall.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: That tall, bright building.  Near there.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Investment banking.  Moving money from place to place.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: If this was my office, I wouldn't keep that closed.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I don't spend much time looking out the window.  I'll call you a taxi.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I know the owner of Campton Place.  I could talk to him in the morning.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Don't.  It was a shitty job anyway. I overreacted.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I don't think I've ever spent this much time with someone who didn't even ask my name.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: The maitre d' called you Christine.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Goodnight, Christy.  It was nice meeting you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Give me an address so I can send your shirt back.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I have a confession to make.  Someone gave me six-hundred dollars to spill drinks on you, as a practical joke.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: They said five hundred.  I said six. They said the man in the gray flannel suit.  I think I said, you mean the attractive guy in the gray flannel suit?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Didn't think I'd ever see you again.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It was left in my hotel room, well, not really mine.  You're saying it's not you?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I think I would remember.  What makes you think it's me?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Do you mind if I sit?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Sure.  You alright?  Is this still that contest you're in...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I'm tired.  I'm sorry, I should go. I've been enough of a nuisance.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Let me go get some clothes on. We'll talk, okay?  Be right back.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Yeah.  First Communion.  Aren't I a little angel?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Take the picture out of the frame and show it to me.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: God, wake up, it's a con!

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I could've handed you to them.  They find me now, I'm dead...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: You don't have a choice.  No one else is going to tell you what's going on.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: You can talk while I drive us to the police.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: No cops.  I've got a warrant out. Mail fraud.  They'll take me in, but you won't be able to prove anything else.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I don't know, nobody does.  I'm an employee.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I know things... like who you can trust.  Like that your brother was in on it from the beginning.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Yeah?  I was your waitress on your birthday.  Connie told you about C.R.S. that day, remember?  I was already playing my part, <u>before</u> you started the game.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: It wasn't his fault.  He thought it was his only way back.  They fleeced him real good.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: How?  How could they have gotten anything?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: They did the same to him as they did to you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Why else would they be willing to put you under... ?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Overseas operator?  Please dial Allgemeine Bank, Zurich.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: They don't care about you anymore. Alive or dead is the same, as long as they bury you deep enough.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: My name's not Christine.  It's not my real...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: It's just money.  You should be glad you're alive.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It might be best if we didn't talk.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: All I mean is... someone like you...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: How many times have you done this? I'm interested.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Whatever kind of nickel-and-dime shit you did before, this is more than just me.  Your friends raided pension plans, and payrolls... they took just over six-hundred million.  You ruined people's lives.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: What do you mean?  I checked them myself.  I made the calls...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Mm... I wouldn't worry about it.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Nicholas, okay... you're not about to shoot anyone...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: What do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: You tell me... I want to know who's behind this.  Who did this to me... how, why... ?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: How deluded can you be?  There's no <u>why</u>...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: It wasn't you.  It wasn't personal...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: It could have been any asshole with a couple hundred million in the bank.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Call them, tell them to get the boss up here.  Tell them I'll kill you...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: They will!  You tell them if they don't come now, I will shoot you!

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: That gun.  That... that's not automatic.  The guard had an automatic...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Just... wait.  Just wait!  Okay... please, I'm not kidding anymore...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: He's got a gun.  Everyone, he's got a <u>real</u> gun up here!  Real situation!  ... damn it...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Nicholas, this is fake.  It's all part of the game...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Listen very carefully, I'm telling the truth... this is the game.  This was all the game.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Bullshit.  They killed him. Feingold, Fisher, whoever... they shot him...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: No, now wait... think about it.  What did you see... ?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: What did you <u>really see</u>?  This whole time... special effects, squibs, like in the movies.  Please, you've got to believe me...  He's got a gun, with real bullets!

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Okay... okay...  I put it down.  Now open that door. Mister Fisher's right on the other side of that door.  He's an actor...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: No!  You take another step, I'll shoot!  They're trying to kill me...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: You're wrong.  You're about to make the biggest mistake of your life. Put that gun down.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Think about it!  They followed you every step of the way.  There was always a safety net.  The taxi, there was a diver.  At my house, the window was rigged... they shot at us with blanks...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: It is.  It's what you hired us for. Nobody touched your money.  Nobody stole anything.  They're waiting on the other side of that door with champagne... all your friends... it's a celebration...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Open that door, you'll see.  Your brother's there... Conrad.  He's there.  It's your birthday party...

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Please, Nicholas, let me show you...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Hi.  Didn't get a chance to say goodbye.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: That's my fault.  I get too worked up at these.  I'm very method.  You do know... that's not my name.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I didn't know what else to call you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I have to get to the airport...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Where are you going in such a hurry?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: There's another gig starting in Saudi Arabia.  I'm just a walk-on this time though.  Bit-part.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: What about dinner sometime, when you get back?  Would that be... ?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Is this something you're interested in?  I'm not really that person I was.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I realize.  Maybe you could... tell me a little about yourself.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: "Seymour Butts."  I never get tired of that one.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: That's why it's a classic.  Come on, man... how 'bout a hug... ?

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: They gave me a free jacket at the door.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: Not after I'm done with it.  Actually, I've been here.  In grad-school I bought crystal-meth from the maitre d'.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: So do you.  And to think I was worried...

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: How long's it been?  Since mom died... four years?  How are you?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Divorced.  Remarried to some pediatrician or gynecologist, or pediatric gynaecologist, in Sausalito.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: Too bad, I liked her.  So, you're all alone in the House of Pain?

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: Nowhere in particular.  Don't you keep track of my whereabouts anymore?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Connie... what brings you here?  Is everything alright?

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: I don't need anything from you.  I was laying on a beach somewhere in Spain, naked, and, it hit me -- Nickie's birthday.  So, here I am, four layovers, twenty-seven hours flying and one donkey ride later. Not necessarily in that order.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: "Consumer Recrreation Services." What, do they make golf clubs?

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: They make your life fun.  Their only guarantee is you will not be bored.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: You've heard of it.  You've seen other people having it.  They're an entertainment service, but more than that.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: I thought you'd like this.  Best thing I ever did.  If you don't want to do it, DON'T...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Okay, okay... okay?  I just... you know I hate surprises.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: Just drive, man.  It's fucking nuts!

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: They're methodical.  They're nothing if they're not that.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: C.R.S.  Who do you think?  Jesus H., thank your lucky charms.  To think what I almost got you into.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: They fuck you and they fuck you and they fuck you.  And then, just when you think it's done, that's when the <u>real</u> fucking begins.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: It doesn't stop, Nick.  I paid the bill, I gave 'em their money, but it all started again.  They won't leave me alone...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: What have they been doing to you?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Calm down.  Why would they keep playing after you paid?

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: You think I know?  I paid them <u>more</u> to make it stop.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It's a flat tire.  That's all.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: We're going to figure this out.  Get a grip on yourself.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Do you know how to change a tire?

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: No.  Do you?  Can't be too hard, can it?  I don't think we should be here out in the open like this.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: No!  You're one of them.  Of course, it makes perfect sense!

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: No, it doesn't!  Those keys were put there.  I didn't even know...

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: You're behind this, aren't you?  You and your sick friends.  Well, make it stop!

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Listen to yourself.   Why would I do anything like what you're describing?

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: Because you hate me.  Because you had to be here, when mom died.  Because you had to do it alone.  Well, don't you think if I'd known... I'd've been here too.  I'd have been here...

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: I'm sorry, Christ, I'm sorry!  How many more times do I have to say I'm sorry before you forgive me... ?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: You know... how'd you manage the gun? I mean...

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: Baby, they were all over the house with metal detectors.  They switched your gun with a look-alike, rigged barrel, loaded with blanks.  Pop-gun.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: This... ?  Oh, this is just... this is the bill.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: Oh, God yes please.  Thanks, man. I'll take you up on that.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.  She called a cab. Said something about catching a plane.

turns.speaker: COUNSELOR
turns.text: No money, no identification or passport.  You are in a fix.  What did happen to you?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Well, where to begin.  It's complicated...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: What happened was, I'm on vacation, alone... I was robbed, at gunpoint. They hit me and ran.  Two men, a few blocks away.  They took my wallet, money... all of it.  So...

turns.speaker: COUNSELOR
turns.text: Have you gone to the police?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I don't speak Spanish.  All I need is to get back... just enough for that.

turns.speaker: COUNSELOR
turns.text: We'll help with the police, if you want to bother.  As far as money goes... can I make a suggestion?  You say you were mugged?

turns.speaker: COUNSELOR
turns.text: And, they didn't take that watch?

turns.speaker: COUNSELOR
turns.text: How much is it?  A few thousand, at least.  A Rolex like that... lucky for you they missed it.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: What happened to you, Nick?  I mean, look at yourself...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I know, look at me, well...  What happened?  I don't know.  I don't even really know.  I have some things to try to take care of... I need the car a little while.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Of course you can have it if you need it.  Can I get you something to eat?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: The last few days, um... I've been thinking... had a lot of spare time.  I want to tell you... I'm starting to understand why you left me.  I've been resenting you for it, maybe, but ... I want to apologize, for all of it.  For shutting you out, for not being there.  I...  Anyway, I hope you can forgive me.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It would mean a lot to me... if you and I could be friends.  If I could have you back in my life... in some small way.  It would be important.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It's just a t.v.  He's just an actor.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: We have to head out... just wanted to say goodbye.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: You're going?  Well, thanks again.  Good to see you, Rachel...  Thanks for coming, Mel.  I'll get your car back.  Right now it's, uh... at the zoo.  Sorry.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: Jim Feingold, V.P., E.D.A. Engineering and Data Analysis.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I'm not quite sure how this works. My brother...

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: V-A-N... O-R-T-O-N...  A gift from Conrad Van Orton. Interesting...

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: Your brother was a client with our London branch.  We do a sort of informal scoring.  His numbers were outstanding.  Sure you're not hungry at all... ? Tung Hoy, best in Chinatown...

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: You need to fill out those forms. Application, psych-tests: M.M.P.I. and T.A.T.  For the financial questionnaire, don't answer anything you don't feel like.  We'll run a T.R.W....

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: I don't write the questions.  I just review them.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: We want a sense of your overall capabilities, limitations, turn-ons, turn-offs...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: No, I mean, what is it FOR?  What are you selling?

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: Tailored specifically to each participant.  Think of it as a great vacation, except you don't go to it, it comes to you.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Do you really expect me to participate without knowing a single thing?

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: First, admit to yourself that it sounds intriguing.  Second, you don't have to decide today.  Take the silly tests, fill out the forms.  One day, the game begins.  You either love it or hate it.  Decide then.  We're like an experimental Book-of-the-Month- Club; drop out at any time with no further obligation.  That was my sales pitch.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: An hour for those... maybe another for the physical.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: Cursory examination.  Turn-your-head- and-cough sort of thing.  You'll be out of here in no time.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Don't worry.  It's been terrific spending the entire day with your "crack team".

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: One guarantee.  Payment's entirely at your brother's discretion and, as a gift, dependent on your satisfaction.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: You mean, I don't like it, he doesn't pay?

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: It's never happened.  We've never had an unsatisfied customer.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: That's right -- you're a left-brain word fetishist.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: Hey, everyone -- snack time!  Here... here you go...

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: Look, it was just a job.  Nothing personal, ya know?  I play my part, improvise a little.  That's what I'm good at.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I'm tired of dealing with peons.  I need to get to whoever's in charge.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: Nobody knows, pal.  Nobody gets the big picture...  Jason, Tommy, cut it out!
